page.title: 07BISHOP'S CLEEVE:The Present
page.content: {Bishop's Cleeve}is divided into four by the busy A435,Gloucester to Evesham trunk road and by a locally important minor road from Woodmancote to Stoke Orchard.It has a population of 7000 mainly housed in pre-war and modern housing estates.The oldest part in the centre is now mainly shops at Church Road and The Green.There is a large selection of amenities for the number of inhabitants,but the centre draws in people from the surrounding area. {Shops;}Supermarkets,2, Food shops,9, other shops,16. Building Societies,7;Restaurant and Take aways,3;Garages,2;Banks,2;Post office,Doctor and Dentists Surgeries. {Bishops Cleeve}is a village of smells, from the animal food made at Oldacres Mill and on the outskirts from the near by farms.
